content.question: Three blocks, A, B, and C, are pushed by a constant force <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> that is applied on block A as shown. There is negligible friction between the blocks and the surface. When a small object is attached to the top of block B, the normal force between blocks A and B is <math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math> and the normal force between blocks B and C is <math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math>. How will the values of <math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math> change if the small object is moved to the top of block C and the experiment is repeated?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math><math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math>IncreasesStays the same

<math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math><math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math>DecreasesIncreases

<math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math><math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math>Stays the sameDecreases

<math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math><math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math>Stays the sameIncreases

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub A B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math><math alttext="F sub B C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></mrow></msub></math>Stays the sameIncreases

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
